metadata.title: CVE-2018-6078 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect handling of confusable characters in Omnibox in Google Chromeprior to 65.0.3325.146 allowed a remote attacker to spoof the contents ofthe Omnibox (URL bar) via a crafted domain name.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6078` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
